intro: Duidaea marahuacensis, commonly known as the Mexican orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the cloud forests of central Mexico. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and specialized growth habits. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid with slender pseudobulbs and linear leaves. Its flowers are small, often white or pale green, and are adapted for specific pollinators. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Duidaea marahuacensis is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
